trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect sync: Operational tasks and considerations | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect sync: Operational tasks and considerations | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: This topic describes operational tasks for Azure AD Connect sync and how to prepare for operating this component.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes operational tasks for Azure AD Connect sync and how to prepare for operating this component.

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect sync: Operational tasks and consideration
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect sync: Operational tasks and consideration

trans-unit.source: The objective of this topic is to describe operation tasks for Azure AD Connect sync.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this topic is to describe operation tasks for Azure AD Connect sync.

trans-unit.source: Staging mode
trans-unit.target: Staging mode

trans-unit.source: Staging mode can be used for several scenarios, including:
trans-unit.target: Staging mode can be used for several scenarios, including:

trans-unit.source: High availability.
trans-unit.target: High availability.

trans-unit.source: Test and deploy new configuration changes.
trans-unit.target: Test and deploy new configuration changes.

trans-unit.source: Introduce a new server and decommission the old.
trans-unit.target: Introduce a new server and decommission the old.

trans-unit.source: With a server in staging mode you can make changes to the configuration and preview the changes before you make the server active.
trans-unit.target: With a server in staging mode you can make changes to the configuration and preview the changes before you make the server active.

trans-unit.source: It also allows you to run full import and full synchronization to verify that all changes are expected before you make these into your production environment.
trans-unit.target: It also allows you to run full import and full synchronization to verify that all changes are expected before you make these into your production environment.

trans-unit.source: During installation you can select the server to be in **staging mode**.
trans-unit.target: During installation you can select the server to be in **staging mode**.

trans-unit.source: This will make the server active for import and synchronization, but it will not do any exports.
trans-unit.target: This will make the server active for import and synchronization, but it will not do any exports.

trans-unit.source: A server in staging mode will not run password sync or enable password writeback even if you select these features.
trans-unit.target: A server in staging mode will not run password sync or enable password writeback even if you select these features.

trans-unit.source: When you disable staging mode, the server will start exporting and enable password sync and password writeback (if enabled).
trans-unit.target: When you disable staging mode, the server will start exporting and enable password sync and password writeback (if enabled).

trans-unit.source: A server in staging mode will continue to receive changes from Active Directory and Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: A server in staging mode will continue to receive changes from Active Directory and Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: It will therefor always have a copy of the latest changes and can very fast take over the responsibilities of another server.
trans-unit.target: It will therefor always have a copy of the latest changes and can very fast take over the responsibilities of another server.

trans-unit.source: If you make configuration changes to your primary server, it is your responsibility to make the same changes to the server(s) in staging mode.
trans-unit.target: If you make configuration changes to your primary server, it is your responsibility to make the same changes to the server(s) in staging mode.

trans-unit.source: For those of you with knowledge of older sync technologies, the staging mode is different since the server has its own SQL database.
trans-unit.target: For those of you with knowledge of older sync technologies, the staging mode is different since the server has its own SQL database.

trans-unit.source: This allows the staging mode server to be located in a different datacenter.
trans-unit.target: This allows the staging mode server to be located in a different datacenter.

trans-unit.source: Verify the configuration of a server
trans-unit.target: Verify the configuration of a server

trans-unit.source: To apply this method, follow these steps:
trans-unit.target: To apply this method, follow these steps:

trans-unit.source: Prepare
trans-unit.target: Prepare

trans-unit.source: Import and Synchronize
trans-unit.target: Import and Synchronize

trans-unit.source: Verify
trans-unit.target: Verify

trans-unit.source: Switch active server
trans-unit.target: Switch active server

trans-unit.source: Prepare
trans-unit.target: Prepare

trans-unit.source: Install Azure AD Connect, select **staging mode**, and unselect **start synchronization** on the last page in the installation wizard.
trans-unit.target: Install Azure AD Connect, select **staging mode**, and unselect **start synchronization** on the last page in the installation wizard.

trans-unit.source: This will allow us to run the sync engine manually.
trans-unit.target: This will allow us to run the sync engine manually.

trans-unit.source: ![ReadyToConfigure](./media/active-directory-aadconnectsync-operations/readytoconfigure.png)
trans-unit.target: ![ReadyToConfigure](./media/active-directory-aadconnectsync-operations/readytoconfigure.png)

trans-unit.source: Logoff/logon and from the start menu select **Synchronization Service**.
trans-unit.target: Logoff/logon and from the start menu select **Synchronization Service**.

trans-unit.source: Import and Synchronize
trans-unit.target: Import and Synchronize

trans-unit.source: Select **Connectors**, and select the first Connector with the type **Active Directory Domain Services**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Connectors**, and select the first Connector with the type **Active Directory Domain Services**.

trans-unit.source: Click on **Run**, select **Full import**, and **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Click on **Run**, select **Full import**, and **OK**.

trans-unit.source: Do this for all Connectors of this type.
trans-unit.target: Do this for all Connectors of this type.

trans-unit.source: Select the Connector with type **Azure Active Directory (Microsoft)**.
trans-unit.target: Select the Connector with type **Azure Active Directory (Microsoft)**.

trans-unit.source: Click on **Run**, select **Full import**, and **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Click on **Run**, select **Full import**, and **OK**.

trans-unit.source: Make sure Connectors is still selected and for each Connector with type **Active Directory Domain Services**, click **Run**, select **Delta Synchronization**, and **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Make sure Connectors is still selected and for each Connector with type **Active Directory Domain Services**, click **Run**, select **Delta Synchronization**, and **OK**.

trans-unit.source: Select the Connector with type **Azure Active Directory (Microsoft)**.
trans-unit.target: Select the Connector with type **Azure Active Directory (Microsoft)**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Run**, select **Delta Synchronization**, and then OK.
trans-unit.target: Click **Run**, select **Delta Synchronization**, and then OK.

trans-unit.source: You have now staged export changes to Azure AD and on-premises AD (if you are using Exchange hybrid deployment).
trans-unit.target: You have now staged export changes to Azure AD and on-premises AD (if you are using Exchange hybrid deployment).

trans-unit.source: The next steps will allow you to inspect what is about to change before you actually start the export to the directories.
trans-unit.target: The next steps will allow you to inspect what is about to change before you actually start the export to the directories.

trans-unit.source: Verify
trans-unit.target: Verify

trans-unit.source: Start a cmd prompt and go to `%Program Files%\Microsoft Azure AD Sync\bin`
trans-unit.target: Start a cmd prompt and go to `%Program Files%\Microsoft Azure AD Sync\bin`

trans-unit.source: Run: `csexport "Name of Connector" %temp%\export.xml /f:x`
trans-unit.target: Run: `csexport "Name of Connector" %temp%\export.xml /f:x`

trans-unit.source: The name of the Connector can be found in Synchronization Service.
trans-unit.target: The name of the Connector can be found in Synchronization Service.

trans-unit.source: It will have a name similar to “contoso.com – AAD” for Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: It will have a name similar to “contoso.com – AAD” for Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: Run: `CSExportAnalyzer %temp%\export.xml > %temp%\export.csv`
trans-unit.target: Run: `CSExportAnalyzer %temp%\export.xml > %temp%\export.csv`

trans-unit.source: You now have a file in %temp% named export.csv which can be examined in Microsoft Excel.
trans-unit.target: You now have a file in %temp% named export.csv which can be examined in Microsoft Excel.

trans-unit.source: This file contains all changes which are about to be exported.
trans-unit.target: This file contains all changes which are about to be exported.

trans-unit.source: Make necessary changes to the data or configuration and run these steps again (Import and Synchronize and Verify) until the changes which are about to be exported are expected.
trans-unit.target: Make necessary changes to the data or configuration and run these steps again (Import and Synchronize and Verify) until the changes which are about to be exported are expected.

trans-unit.source: Understanding the export.csv file
trans-unit.target: Understanding the export.csv file

trans-unit.source: Most of the file is self-explanatory.
trans-unit.target: Most of the file is self-explanatory.

trans-unit.source: Some abbreviations to understand the content:
trans-unit.target: Some abbreviations to understand the content:

trans-unit.source: OMODT – Object Modification Type.
trans-unit.target: OMODT – Object Modification Type.

trans-unit.source: Indicates if the operation at an object level is an Add, Update, or Delete.
trans-unit.target: Indicates if the operation at an object level is an Add, Update, or Delete.

trans-unit.source: AMODT – Attribute Modification Type.
trans-unit.target: AMODT – Attribute Modification Type.

trans-unit.source: Indicates if the operation at an attribute level is an Add, Update, or delete.
trans-unit.target: Indicates if the operation at an attribute level is an Add, Update, or delete.

trans-unit.source: If the attribute value is multi-valued then not every change is displayed.
trans-unit.target: If the attribute value is multi-valued then not every change is displayed.

trans-unit.source: Only the number of values added and removed will be visible.
trans-unit.target: Only the number of values added and removed will be visible.

trans-unit.source: Switch active server
trans-unit.target: Switch active server

trans-unit.source: On the currently active server either turn off the server (DirSync/FIM/Azure AD Sync) so it is not exporting to Azure AD or set it in staging mode (Azure AD Connect).
trans-unit.target: On the currently active server either turn off the server (DirSync/FIM/Azure AD Sync) so it is not exporting to Azure AD or set it in staging mode (Azure AD Connect).

trans-unit.source: Run the installation wizard on the server in **staging mode** and disable **staging mode**.
trans-unit.target: Run the installation wizard on the server in **staging mode** and disable **staging mode**.

trans-unit.source: ![ReadyToConfigure](./media/active-directory-aadconnectsync-operations/additionaltasks.png)
trans-unit.target: ![ReadyToConfigure](./media/active-directory-aadconnectsync-operations/additionaltasks.png)

trans-unit.source: Disaster recovery
trans-unit.target: Disaster recovery

trans-unit.source: Part of the implementation design is to plan for what to do in case of a disaster where you lose the sync server.
trans-unit.target: Part of the implementation design is to plan for what to do in case of a disaster where you lose the sync server.

trans-unit.source: There are different models to use and which one to use will depend on several factors including:
trans-unit.target: There are different models to use and which one to use will depend on several factors including:

trans-unit.source: What is your tolerance for not being able make changes to objects in Azure AD during the downtime?
trans-unit.target: What is your tolerance for not being able make changes to objects in Azure AD during the downtime?

trans-unit.source: If you use password synchronization, will the users accept that they have to use the old password in Azure AD in case they change it on-premises?
trans-unit.target: If you use password synchronization, will the users accept that they have to use the old password in Azure AD in case they change it on-premises?

trans-unit.source: Do you have a dependency on real-time operations, such as password writeback?
trans-unit.target: Do you have a dependency on real-time operations, such as password writeback?

trans-unit.source: Depending on the answers to these questions and your organization’s policy one of the following strategies can be implemented:
trans-unit.target: Depending on the answers to these questions and your organization’s policy one of the following strategies can be implemented:

trans-unit.source: Rebuild when needed.
trans-unit.target: Rebuild when needed.

trans-unit.source: Have a spare standby server, known as **staging mode**.
trans-unit.target: Have a spare standby server, known as **staging mode**.

trans-unit.source: Use virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: Use virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: Since Azure AD Connect sync has a dependency on a SQL database, you should also review the SQL High Availability section if you do not use SQL Express, which is included with Azure AD Connect.
trans-unit.target: Since Azure AD Connect sync has a dependency on a SQL database, you should also review the SQL High Availability section if you do not use SQL Express, which is included with Azure AD Connect.

trans-unit.source: Rebuild when needed
trans-unit.target: Rebuild when needed

trans-unit.source: A viable strategy is to plan for a server rebuild when needed.
trans-unit.target: A viable strategy is to plan for a server rebuild when needed.

trans-unit.source: In many cases installing the sync engine and do the initial import and sync can be completed within a few hours.
trans-unit.target: In many cases installing the sync engine and do the initial import and sync can be completed within a few hours.

trans-unit.source: If there isn’t a spare server available, it is possible to temporarily use a domain controller to host the sync engine.
trans-unit.target: If there isn’t a spare server available, it is possible to temporarily use a domain controller to host the sync engine.

trans-unit.source: The sync engine server does not store any state about the objects so the database can be rebuilt from the data in Active Directory and Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: The sync engine server does not store any state about the objects so the database can be rebuilt from the data in Active Directory and Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: The **sourceAnchor** attribute is used to join the objects from on-premises and the cloud.
trans-unit.target: The **sourceAnchor** attribute is used to join the objects from on-premises and the cloud.

trans-unit.source: If you rebuild the server with existing objects on-premises and the cloud, the sync engine will on reinstallation match those together again.
trans-unit.target: If you rebuild the server with existing objects on-premises and the cloud, the sync engine will on reinstallation match those together again.

trans-unit.source: The things you need to document and save are the configuration changes made to the server, such as filtering and synchronization rules.
trans-unit.target: The things you need to document and save are the configuration changes made to the server, such as filtering and synchronization rules.

trans-unit.source: These must be re-applied before you start synchronizing.
trans-unit.target: These must be re-applied before you start synchronizing.

trans-unit.source: Have a spare standby server - staging mode
trans-unit.target: Have a spare standby server - staging mode

trans-unit.source: If you have a more complex environment, then having one or more standby servers is recommended.
trans-unit.target: If you have a more complex environment, then having one or more standby servers is recommended.

trans-unit.source: During installation you can enable a server to be in **staging mode**.
trans-unit.target: During installation you can enable a server to be in **staging mode**.

trans-unit.source: For more details, see [staging mode](#staging-mode).
trans-unit.target: For more details, see [staging mode](#staging-mode).

trans-unit.source: Use virtual machines
trans-unit.target: Use virtual machines

trans-unit.source: A common and supported method is to run the sync engine in a virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: A common and supported method is to run the sync engine in a virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: In case the host has an issue, the image with the sync engine server can be migrated to another server.
trans-unit.target: In case the host has an issue, the image with the sync engine server can be migrated to another server.

trans-unit.source: SQL High Availability
trans-unit.target: SQL High Availability

trans-unit.source: When not using the SQL Server Express which comes with Azure AD Connect, the high availability for SQL Server should also be considered.
trans-unit.target: When not using the SQL Server Express which comes with Azure AD Connect, the high availability for SQL Server should also be considered.

trans-unit.source: The only high availability solution supported is SQL clustering.
trans-unit.target: The only high availability solution supported is SQL clustering.

trans-unit.source: Unsupported solutions include mirroring and Always On.
trans-unit.target: Unsupported solutions include mirroring and Always On.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: Learn more about the [Azure AD Connect sync](active-directory-aadconnectsync-whatis.md) configuration.
trans-unit.target: Learn more about the [Azure AD Connect sync](active-directory-aadconnectsync-whatis.md) configuration.

trans-unit.source: Learn more about [Integrating your on-premises identities with Azure Active Directory](active-directory-aadconnect.md).
trans-unit.target: Learn more about [Integrating your on-premises identities with Azure Active Directory](active-directory-aadconnect.md).
